Legal_Issue: Validity of AstraZeneca's omeprazole patents and whether Apotex infringes them
Evidence_Assessment: Prior art demonstrating known antimicrobial effects and bioavailability enhancement of omeprazole
Expert testimonies on inherent properties in prior treatments
Decision_Outcome: Patents invalidated for anticipation and obviousness
Burden_of_Proof: On AstraZeneca to prove validity and infringement
Credibility_Factor: Expert testimony credibility assessed in determining inherent properties
Legal_Rule: Anticipation and obviousness as grounds for invalidating a patent
Procedural_Issue: Compliance with NOC Regulations procedural requirements
Judicial_Review_Outcome: No judicial review requested; initial decision stands
Review_Standard: Statutory interpretation and factual assessment under Patent Act
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Fair hearing provided to both parties with opportunity to present evidence
Legal_Framework: Statutory framework for patent protection and generic drug approval
Applicant_Challenge: AstraZeneca sought to prevent Apotex from marketing generic omeprazole
Defendant_Response: Denial of infringement and challenge to patent validity
Remedy_Requested: Interim injunction to prevent market entry by Apotex
Outcome: Remedy denied; Apotex allowed to proceed
Remedy_Sought: Prevention of generic product launch pending patent expiry
Legal_Provision: Patent Act provisions on novelty and non-obviousness
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Invalidity due to anticipation and obviousness
Applicable_Process: NOC proceeding for generic drug market authorization
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application for prohibition of Apotex's product approval
